title: Bump nrfxlib-sys and add logging + tracing feature
Fix transmute
body:
Fixes #29 

@rabarar could you try this out to see if it compiles for you now?

title: Fix socket_addr_len
body:
socket_addr_len "Specifies the length in bytes of the buffer pointed to by the buffer argument.", see https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/recvfrom.html.

Now correctly returns the senders IP address.

title: Add tcp over TLS support and secure mode
nrf9151 preview
body: Adding support for the nrf9120 (nrf9151 and nrf9161)

title: Change dates in Changelog to be in ISO8601 format
Update nrfxlib to 2.4.2
body:
- Update nrfxlib
- Remove unnecessary FFI
- Adapt IPC handling to updated nrfxlib

title: Update nrf_modem_os_sem_take()
body: Update nrf_modem_os_sem_take() to send 1 millisecond (1000 us) to the busywait function which takes microseconds not milliseconds.  The current version can prematurely timeout, specifically, during modem init.

title: Add SocketDirection type to Socket Wakers
body: This PR adds a socket direction field to sockets so when their wakers are registered split sockets in separate tasks do not overwrite one another.

title: Update EGU1 and IPC interrupts example in readme.md
body: with the removal of the old interrupt binding method in embassy, update the example to use the `cortex-m-rt` method.

title: Stop gnss when GnssStream is dropped
body:
Fixes issue where GNSS fails on subsequent connects.

According to [nrfxlib docs](https://developer.nordicsemi.com/nRF_Connect_SDK/doc/latest/nrfxlib/nrf_modem/doc/gnss_interface.html) and my tests nrf_modem_gnss_stop() must be called regardless of whether the stream is done or not.

From docs:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93540369/221559260-b2d14095-3577-429f-a794-4d7e9647093c.png)

Also added logging entry for gnss disable

title: Add basic sms sending support
body:
This is a crude basic SMS sending support for nrf-modem.
Implement based on https://github.com/nrfconnect/sdk-nrf/blob/main/lib/sms
Supports for now only sending and only single length messages (so the max message is 160 bit) and only ASCII characters are supported.
It is behind `sms` feature to not increase the library size for users that might not need it/use it (since it includes a 256 elements table to convert ASCII to GMS 7 bit). It also pulls heapless as an extra dependency to work with Strings.
Enabling sms  feature enables the unstable rust feature `array_chunks` so it needs nightly compiler.
I hope since Embassy itself needs a nightly compiler this isn't an issue for now but if yes I will try to find a better option for the simple conversion that is done with in `encode_number`.
Any suggestions/improvements are welcome :).

title: make GnssUsecase fields public
body:
As far I can tell GnssUsecase should be public because otherwise the crate user has no option to affect the low_accuracy and scheduled_downloads_disable options with are supposed to be user configurable, right?
This PR just changes the field visibility to pub.

title: Add required lte_psm_support bool to modem initialization in README.md
body: One small oversight in the read me :)

title: move LTE PSM setup to SystemMode
body:
Not all SIM cards and networks do support PSM mode, if it is enabled then the network login fails and we get no link.
This is for example the case with iBASIS sim cards included with the Nordic Thingy:91.
This changes allows to set psm mode in SystemMode and not use hard-coded one.
Since LteLink is used internal by other functions the the Socker ones it is not possible to add that parameter to it's creation, and since it can be reused this could lead to inconsistent when the user calls in one program with different settings so I moved the AT command out of LteLink.

title: adding async deactivate to ltelink
body: Added async option to blocking drop for LteLink
